post.description:
To initiate a chat, do not provide a `sessionId` nor a `message`.

Continue the conversation by providing the `sessionId` and the `message` that should answer the previous question.

Set the `isPreview` option to `true` to chat with the non-published version of the typebot.

message.description: The answer to the previous chat input. Do not provide it if you are starting a new chat.

sessionId.description: Session ID that you get from the initial chat request to a bot. If not provided, it will create a new session.

typebot.description: Either a Typebot ID or a Typebot object. If you provide a Typebot object, it will be executed in preview mode. ([How can I find my typebot ID?](https://docs.typebot.io/api-reference#how-to-find-my-typebotid)).

isPreview.description: If set to `true`, it will start a Preview session with the unpublished bot and it won't be saved in the Results tab. You need to be authenticated with a bearer token for this to work.

resultId.description: Provide it if you'd like to overwrite an existing result.

isStreamEnabled.description: Set this to `true` if you intend to stream OpenAI completions on a client.

isOnlyRegistering.description: If set to `true`, it will only register the session and not start the chat. This is used for other chat platform integration as it can require a session to be registered before sending the first message.

startGroupId.description: Start chat from a specific group.

startEventId.description: Start chat from a specific event.

clientLogs.description: Logs while executing client side actions

lastMessageNewFormat.description: The sent message is validated and formatted on the backend. This is set only if the message differs from the formatted version.

Set the `isPreview` option to `true` to chat with the non-published version of the typebot.

resultId.description: Provide it if you'd like to overwrite an existing result.

isStreamEnabled.description: Set this to `true` if you intend to stream OpenAI completions on a client.

parameters.name: publicId
parameters.description: [Where to find my bot's public ID?](../how-to#how-to-find-my-publicid)

schema.description: [Where to find my bot's public ID?](../how-to#how-to-find-my-publicid)

message.description: Only provide it if your flow starts with an input block and you'd like to directly provide an answer to it.

isStreamEnabled.description: If enabled, you will be required to stream OpenAI completions on a client and send the generated response back to the API.

resultId.description: Provide it if you'd like to overwrite an existing result.

isOnlyRegistering.description: If set to `true`, it will only register the session and not start the bot. This is used for 3rd party chat platforms as it can require a session to be registered before sending the first message.

sessionId.description: To save and use for /continueChat requests.

lastMessageNewFormat.description: The sent message is validated and formatted on the backend. For example, if for a date input you replied something like `tomorrow`, the backend will convert it to a date string. This field returns the formatted message.

clientSideActions.description: Actions to execute on the client side

logs.description: Logs that were saved during the last execution

dynamicTheme.description: If the typebot contains dynamic avatars, dynamicTheme returns the new avatar URLs whenever their variables are updated.

progress.description: If progress bar is enabled, this field will return a number between 0 and 100 indicating the current progress based on the longest remaining path of the flow.

parameters.name: sessionId
parameters.description: The session ID you got from the [startChat](./start-chat) response.

schema.description: The session ID you got from the [startChat](./start-chat) response.

lastMessageNewFormat.description: The sent message is validated and formatted on the backend. For example, if for a date input you replied something like `tomorrow`, the backend will convert it to a date string. This field returns the formatted message.

clientSideActions.description: Actions to execute on the client side

logs.description: Logs that were saved during the last execution

dynamicTheme.description: If the typebot contains dynamic avatars, dynamicTheme returns the new avatar URLs whenever their variables are updated.

progress.description: If progress bar is enabled, this field will return a number between 0 and 100 indicating the current progress based on the longest remaining path of the flow.

post.description: Use this endpoint to test your bot. The answers will not be saved. And some blocks like "Send email" will be skipped.

isOnlyRegistering.description: If set to `true`, it will only register the session and not start the bot. This is used for 3rd party chat platforms as it can require a session to be registered before sending the first message.

typebot.description: If set, it will override the typebot that is used to start the chat.

sessionId.description: If provided, will be used as the session ID and will overwrite any existing session with the same ID.
To save and use for /continueChat requests.

lastMessageNewFormat.description: The sent message is validated and formatted on the backend. For example, if for a date input you replied something like `tomorrow`, the backend will convert it to a date string. This field returns the formatted message.

clientSideActions.description: Actions to execute on the client side

logs.description: Logs that were saved during the last execution

dynamicTheme.description: If the typebot contains dynamic avatars, dynamicTheme returns the new avatar URLs whenever their variables are updated.

progress.description: If progress bar is enabled, this field will return a number between 0 and 100 indicating the current progress based on the longest remaining path of the flow.

get.summary: Get upload URL for a file
get.description: Used for the web client to get the bucket upload file.

post.description: Used to upload anything from the client to S3 bucket
Used to upload anything from the client to S3 bucket
Update chat session with latest typebot modifications. This is useful when you want to update the typebot in an ongoing session after making changes to it.

type.description: Legacy name for HTTP Request block

oneOf.description: Deprecated, use other dedicated OpenAI compatible blocks instead

sessionExpiryTimeout.description: Expiration delay in hours after latest interaction

type.description: Legacy name for HTTP Request block

issues.description: An array of issues that were responsible for the error
An array of issues that were responsible for the error

attachedFileUrls.description: Can only be provided if current input block is a text input block that allows attachments

audioSentMessage.description: Can only be provided if current input block is a text input that allows audio clips
